prompt.p: A postoperative surgical patient has just been commenced on a blood transfusion of packed red cells for a low haemoglobin. Three minutes after commencing the infusion, she develops lumbar pain, rigors, dyspnoea and hypotension.
Which of the following describes this type of reaction?

modalFeedback.p:
Option D (Haemolytic transfusion reaction) is Correct. Haemolytic transfusion reaction is the most important transfusion reaction due to antigen-antibody reactions from incompatible blood, resulting in severe or fatal intravascular haemolysis.
Option A (Anaphylactic) is Incorrect. The symptoms do not fit with anaphylaxis.
Option B (Endotoxaemia) is Incorrect. The symptoms do not fit with infection.
Option C (Volume overload) is Incorrect. The symptoms do not fit with fluid overload.
Option E (Transfusion related acute lung injury (TRALI)) is Incorrect. The symptoms do not fit with TRALI.
